greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers k such that k and k+1 both have exactly 2 distinct prime factors.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) seems to be asymptotic to c*n*log(n)^2 with c=0.13...
program: (MAGMA) [n: n in [2..200] | #PrimeDivisors(n) eq 2 and #PrimeDivisors(n+1) eq 2]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 05 2018
xref: Analogous sequences for m distinct prime factors: this sequence (m=2), A140077 (m=3), A140078 (m=4), A140079 (m=5).
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 10 2002
